newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hajdutej approves delisting from bourse.
newsitem.headline: Hajdutej approves delisting from bourse.

text.p: Hungarian dairy producer Hajdutej Rt will apply to delist its shares from the Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE) after its shareholders approved the plan on Tuesday, a company director told Reuters.
"The extraordinary general meeting has approved the move and I expect the (delisting) procedure to go through in a few days," Hajdutej Director Ferenc Beres said.
Hajdutej, majority-owned by Netherlands' Nutricia, announced a buyout offer running between February 28 and April 14 for Hajdutej shares at a price of 1,500 forints a share.
On Tuesday Hajdutej shares remained untraded on the BSE, while on March 17, the day they were last traded, closed at 1,500 forints.
